isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - AIR SYSTEM - INSERT VALVE

svcproc.title: INSERT VALVE
svcproc.para: The insert valve is a self-contained valve assembly located in the reduction cylinder cover. It CANNOT be disassembled except for the three O-rings on the outer diameter. The O-rings provide a stationary seal and do not move in the cylinder.

When installing the insert valve in the bottom bore of the cover, apply Fuller Transmission #71206 silicone lubricant or its equivalent to the O-rings and cylinder walls. Install the valve in the bore with the flat surface to the inside. When installing the special valve retaining nut, apply Fuller Transmission #71204 adhesive/sealant or its equivalent to the threads and tighten. Refer to the TORQUE CHART
.

Travel of the small insert valve piston is only 1/32 inch. As shown in the illustrations ( Figure 8 and Figure 9), when NO AIR is applied to the top side of the valve piston, CONSTANT AIR supplied from the regulator passes freely through the insert valve and to the backside of the cylinder piston, moving the yoke bar forward to disengage deep reduction gearing (LO RANGE AND HI RANGE). When air is applied to the top side of the valve piston through the signal line, the piston moves down to cut off air supplied to the backside of the cylinder piston. This air is exhausted out the bottom port of the cover when CONSTANT AIR supplied from the regulator is directed to the front side of the cylinder piston, moving the yoke bar rearward to engage the deep reduction gearing (DEEP REDUCTION).
